com.vmware.vapi.diagnostics

Class Slf4jMDCLogConfigurator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vmware.vapi.diagnostics.Slf4jMDCLogConfigurator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LogDiagnosticsConfigurator

    public final class Slf4jMDCLogConfigurator
extends java.lang.Object
implements LogDiagnosticsConfigurator
    SLF4J MDC based log configurator.

    Configures log diagnostic context as String key and values pairs. Context is supposed to appear in logging traces by the means supported by Log4j. Context is maintained on a per thread basis.

    Thread switching (like running task in ThreadPoolExecutor or newly created Thread require explicit action in order to transfer the context to the new thread and later clean it up.

    See Also:
    MDC

      • cleanUpContext

        public void cleanUpContext()
        Description copied from interface: LogDiagnosticsConfigurator
        Clean the logging context for the current thread.

        WARNING: this will clear the while underlying storage of the context, e.g. the slf4j MDC. It is possible that other data is stored in that storage, which is not supposed to be cleared. Use this method with caution, the vAPI infrastructure will never invoke it.

        Specified by:
        cleanUpContext in interface LogDiagnosticsConfigurator

      • cleanUpContext

        public void cleanUpContext(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> keys)
        Description copied from interface: LogDiagnosticsConfigurator
        Cleans specified keys from the logging context. Removes the mappings for these keys from the underlying context storage (e.g. slf4j MDC).
        Specified by:
        cleanUpContext in interface LogDiagnosticsConfigurator
        Parameters:
        keys - the keys to be cleaned; must not be null

      • getContext

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getContext()
        Description copied from interface: LogDiagnosticsConfigurator
        Retrieve the logging context for the current thread (Thread.currentThread()).

        The result can be used to transfer the logging context to another thread, which continues the execution of the logical operation

        Specified by:
        getContext in interface LogDiagnosticsConfigurator
        Returns:
        Map representing the log diagnostics context
